exclusion:
1. Shake the device for few seconds.
  2. Place it flat on the table.
  3. Wait for two buzzer sounds with two times green LED. This indicates the device is ready for gesture. Red/Yellow blinking LED shows readiness.
  4. Now Turn the device in upright position.
inclusion:
1. When in factory reset state connect two of the pins in the ring (using a wire or water or two wet fingers) for two seconds. Short beeps and yellow LED help counting.
  2. Release connection. This process only works when the device is in factory reset state.
label: WWDZWE
overview:
The Water Contact Sensor is placed on critical positions within the home and will detect even smallest drops of water thanks to the capillary effect (water is soaked into the colored sensor channel). Detected water results in an alarm sent to a central gateway using Z-Wave wireless protocol.

The unique feature of this device is the central sensor ring with 4 metal water probes on four corners. This ensures the detection works in all possible orientations of the device.

An external second water detection probe can be connected to the main device and it will act as second sensor differing from the primary sensor probe inside the ring. The internal temperature sensor will report freezing condition to protect water installation from further damaging.
wakeup: Wakeup the device by connecting two of the pins for 5 seconds.

parameters.label: Sensor Functions
parameters.description: This parameter defines which sensor function of the device is active
parameters.overview:
Bit 0: Built-In Detection Probe
Bit 1: Remote Water Detection Probe
Bit 2: Overhead Detection
Bit 3: Freeze Detection

parameters.label: Water Leak Cancelation Command Behavior
parameters.description: Defines when a BASIC command Value to send to cancel water alarm
parameters.overview:
0: Send BASIC SET command when Water Alarm canceled either Built-In OR on Remote Probe

1: Send BASIC SET command when Water Alarm canceled on Built-In AND on Remote Probe

parameters.label: Temperature Sensor Report
parameters.description: Defines if and how a temperature value is reported.

parameters.label: Temperature Sensor Report Threshold
parameters.description: Defines the change in temperature value to cause unsolicited sending of an report.
parameters.overview:
0x00-0xff: Value in Celsius (example: 0x02 = 2 °C)

0x100-0x1ff: Value in Fahrenheit (example: 0x102 = 2 °F)

parameters.label: Temperature Sensor Report Offset
parameters.description: Defines a temperature offset for the reported temperature. This parameter can be used to compensate for certain temperature deviations.
parameters.overview:
0x00-0xff: Positive Deviation in Celsius (e.g. 0x02 = +2 °C)
0x1000-0x10ff: Negative Deviation in Celsius (e.g. 0x02 = -2 °C)
0x0100-0x01ff: Positive Deviation in Fahrenheit (e.g. 0x02 = +2 °F)
0x1100-0x11ff: Negative Deviation in Fahrenheit (e.g. 0x02 = -2 °F)

parameters.label: Temperature Overheat Trigger
parameters.description: Sets the temperature to trigger and overheat alarm and
parameters.overview:
0x00-0xff: Value in Celsius (example: 0x02 = 2 °C)
0x100-0x1ff: Value in Fahrenheit (example: 0x102 = 2 °F)

parameters.label: Temperature Overheat Reset Trigger Value
parameters.description: Sets the temperature to reset the overheat alarm and
parameters.overview:
0x00-0xff: Value in Celsius (example: 0x02 = 2 °C)
0x100-0x1ff: Value in Fahrenheit (example: 0x102 = 2 °F)

parameters.label: Freeze Trigger Value
parameters.description: Sets the temperature threshold to cause a freeze alarm
parameters.overview:
0x00-0xff: Value in Celsius (example: 0x02 = 2 °C)
0x100-0x1ff: Value in Fahrenheit (example: 0x102 = 2 °F)

parameters.label: Freeze Trigger Reset Value
parameters.description: Sets the temperature threshold to reset a freeze alarm
parameters.overview:
0x00-0xff: Value in Celsius (example: 0x02 = 2 °C)
0x100-0x1ff: Value in Fahrenheit (example: 0x102 = 2 °F)

parameters.label: Built-In Leak Detection Command Value
parameters.description: Defines what BASIC command Value to send into Association Group 3

parameters.label: Built-In Leak Detection Reset Command Value
parameters.description: Defines what BASIC command Value to send into Association Group 3

parameters.label: Remote Leak Detection Command Value
parameters.description: Defines what BASIC command Value to send into Association Group 3

parameters.label: Remote Leak Detection Reset Command Value
parameters.description: Defines what BASIC command Value to send into Association Group 3

parameters.label: Temperature Overhead Action Value
parameters.description: Defines what BASIC command Value to send into Association Group 4

parameters.label: Temperature Overhead Action Reset Value
parameters.description: Defines what BASIC command Value to send into Association Group 4

parameters.label: Freeze Association Action Command
parameters.description: Defines what BASIC command Value to send into Association Group 5

parameters.label: Freeze Association Reset Command
parameters.description: Defines what BASIC command Value to send into Association Group 5

parameters.label: Resent Water Leak Notification time
parameters.description: Defines the interval of resending water leak notification if the water is still present

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.description: Lifeline. All alarms that shall be sent to the gateway

associations.label: Switch on leak
associations.description: Switch Devices when Built-In Leak Sensor alerts

associations.label: Switch on pad leak
associations.description: Switch Devices when Remote Leak Sensor Pad alerts

associations.label: Switch on temperature too high
associations.description: Switch Devices when temperature raise above threshold

associations.label: Switch on temperature too low
associations.description: Switch Devices when temperature falls below threshold
